{{Quote|The key to Varys is that he's one way in public, when he's working, very fey, giggly, and effete for want of a better word, but there are moments when he drops all that and speaks honestly. That stuff is great to play. When Ned asks Varys who he truly serves, and Varys answers, "The realm," I think that's true. There's a moral code there... He sees in Tyrion someone who plays the game well, and Varys loves playing the game. Ned was too honorable and too good - he disdained the game.|'''Conleth Hill''' on playing Varys<ref>''[[Inside HBO's Game of Thrones]]''</ref>}}
'''Conleth Hill''' (born 24 November 1964) is a Northern Irish film, stage and television actor. His career has been focused on stage work, where he has been twice nominated for the Tony Award and has won the Laurence Olivier. He recently appeared in the film [[wikipedia:Whatever Works|''Whatever Works'']] with [[wikipedia:Larry David|Larry David]] and directed by [[wikipedia:Woody Allen|Woody Allen]], and was a regular on the [[wikipedia:Jennifer Saunders|Jennifer Saunders]] comedy series [[wikipedia:The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle|''The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle'']].

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', Hill is playing the role of [[Varys]]. He was confirmed in the role on 15 July 2010. He initially appeared as a guest star in the [[Season 1|first season]] and joined the starring cast for the [[Season 2|second season]]. He also voices the character of Varys in the ''Game of Thrones'' role-playing [[Game of Thrones (computer game)|video game]].
